meanings.definition: A postage stamp sold at a price higher than its face value, with the excess amount going to a charitable cause.
meanings.sent1: I bought some semipostals to support a charity event.
meanings.sent2: Collectors enjoy adding semipostals to their stamp collections.
meanings.sent3: The semipostals were so popular that they raised a lot of money for the charity.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of semipostals was a colorful display of generosity.
meanings.sent5: The semipostals made a significant impact on fundraising efforts.

meanings.definition: A type of stamp that combines both postal and charity functions.
meanings.sent1: The semipostals were used to send letters and support a cause.
meanings.sent2: The post office introduced new semipostals for special occasions.
meanings.sent3: It was heartwarming to see the semipostals helping both mail delivery and charity work.
meanings.sent4: The semipostals symbolized the unity of postal services and charitable organizations.
meanings.sent5: Using semipostals is a great way to give back while sending mail.
